programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The Pennzoil 400 from Las Vegas Motor Speedway. Vegas native Kyle Busch is coming off victory at Fontana in his new No. 8 ride for Richard Childress Racing, with top-4s in his last four Cup starts on this 1.5-mile track. Alex Bowman (No. 48 car) won this race last year.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton brings his unique style to the day's biggest sports stories. Joined by guests and analysts, Carton will give the first perspective of the day on all the major topics.

programme.title: Skip and Shannon: Undisputed
programme.desc: Skip and Shannon: Undisputed is a daily sports debate show starring Skip Bayless and Shannon Sharpe, and moderated by Jen Hale. Every day Skip and Shannon will give their unfiltered, incisive, passionate opinions on the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd With Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Host Colin Cowherd breaks down the biggest stories and interviews the biggest guests in sports. He is joined daily by news anchor Jason McIntyre.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard, and Kevin Wildes bring viewers spirited dialogue and thought-provoking discussion on the day's biggest sports stories.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Emmanuel Acho, Joy Taylor, and LeSean McCoy bring a fun, passionate, smart, and energetic discussion to the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub
programme.desc: Daily motor-sports discussion and interviews from the "hub" of NASCAR in Charlotte.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Series
programme.desc: The Alsco Uniforms 300 from Las Vegas Motor Speedway. Josh Berry (No. 8 car) has won two of the last three Xfinity Series races on this 1.5-mile circuit. He sits ninth in points after two races, with Austin Hill (21), John Hunter Nemechek (20) and Justin Allgaier (7) leading the way.
